Czech: Kremlin gave in reluctantly. The general secretary does not trust Volkov. But losing Soviet soil on Kolguyev is out of the question."

English: Hm... Volkov, Zubarev, Burtsov, Moltov, Limyen, Garodsky, Yenotov, Dyrbov, Aspidov and Shvernik... People seen with Volkov or voting on his matters.\nI don't recognize most of the names. Is it some form of political clique or is it a coincidence? What am I even looking at?
What is the goal? Why this archipelago again? Livanoch had to take Malden to get in range to fire his missiles.\nThat cannot be Volkov's plan, he might as well just use a nuclear submarine.

He needed reinforcements... remote island in the middle of the Pacific... the fastest plane ca get here in twelve hours.\nLetters take weeks to deliver... There are handful of radios capable of such a long distance...
Far away and isolated... At the end of the world...
Everon... Although an epicentre for both wars, it is not the price. The island is between Malden and Kolguyev.\nWhoever controls it can launch attacks against the other.
Everon is only a stepping stone. A launching pad for the true invasion - of Malden.
Whatever Volkov desires is on Malden. But what is it?
Comrade major, enjoying the night's breeze?
Too cold for that, Kaplinsky. What's the situation?
We unloaded the latest shipment of weapons from Kolguyev. We also secured the hills, there is no enemy patrol this side of the mountains.
Good work.
You can always count on us, comrade major.
Then let's go. We have to strike before dusk.
Good luck, Russian.
Something's off...
